item.description:
June 14th to the 29th is the BarPlays Festival, plays set in bars paced in bars.

Everyman Bistro, on Valley street, located in the American Locomotive Works complex (ALCO) is a great space with frequent events, has a full menu and a great staff. Meet a little before the 7PM start times for the plays to get drinks, seating and food, perhaps not in the order. (If Iron Horse Way, doesn't show up in your GPS, try 510 Valley Street, Providence)



  • Fracture by Amanda Weir directed by Amanda Weir Drama surrounds you. In parts.
  • White Glove by Charlotte Meehan directed by Geoffrey Monti A look at beauty, commerce, aging and one's own navel.
  • Life Preserver by Kobun Kaluza directed by David Higgins A short play with an epic story.
  • Special Visit by Rory Raven


More information about the places is availabe on the BarPlays Festival site.


    Over a dozen plays
    All around Providence
    Last two weeks of June
    No cover
    No reservations
    Tip your Bartender
item.name: Bar Plays @ Everyman Bistro
